questions.question: Your sister sings well, …………………….?
questions.description: We make question tags in the simple present tense with do and does. Note that we use a negative tag after an affirmative sentence.

questions.question: Samuel passed the test, …………………….?
questions.description: In the simple past tense we make question tags with did.

questions.question: She recognized him, ……………………..?
questions.description: In the simple past tense we make question tags with did.

questions.question: Someone wanted a drink, ……………………..?
questions.description: In question tags we use they to refer to somebody.

questions.question: You like mushrooms, ……………………..?
questions.description: We make question tags in the simple present tense with do and does. Note that we use a negative tag after an affirmative sentence.

questions.question: He works hard, ……………………….?
questions.description: We make question tags in the simple present tense with do and does. Note that we use a negative tag after an affirmative sentence.

questions.question: ‘Is your son married?’ ‘Yes, he ………………..’
questions.description: Affirmative short answers have the form ‘Yes + pronoun + auxiliary’.

questions.question: ‘He took the money.’ ‘No, he ……………………’
questions.description: Negative short answers have the form ‘No + pronoun + auxiliary + n’t’

questions.question: He doesn’t speak German. …………………….. do I.
questions.description: Negative additions to negative statements are made with ‘nor / neither + auxiliary + subject’.

questions.question: She can’t swim. Neither ……………………..
questions.description: Negative additions to negative statements are made with ‘nor / neither + auxiliary + subject’.

questions.question: My husband loves music. …………………. do I.
questions.description: Affirmative additions to affirmative statements are made with ‘so + auxiliary + subject’.

questions.question: ‘I didn’t hear the sound.’ ‘……………………. did I.’
